intro: Trichostephanus, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. They are characterized by their showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The leaves are typically alternate, palmately lobed, and often covered in fine hairs. Trichostephanus species are drought-tolerant and adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments.
